pageContext.title: In brief: Grab and Toyota deepen collaboration to make rides more efficient
pageContext.content:
Toyota Motor is offering its Total-care Service for 1,500 Toyota vehicles owned by Grab in Singapore through its subsidiary GrabRentals.

The Total-care Service was developed especially for ride-hailing firms. Working with companies like Grab, Toyota can leverage onboard telematics data through a shared information platform to provide services such as fleet management, automotive insurance, and vehicle maintenance packages to extend the life of ride-hailing vehicles, and enhance the driving experience for the end user.

Source: Grab

Toyota and Grab will gradually expand the service to Grab’s Toyota vehicles in other Southeast Asian countries. Grab aims to have Toyota models make up a quarter of its total fleet across all markets by 2020.

Toyota is the lead investor in Grab’s ongoing US$3 billion series H funding round, with the Japanese carmaker injecting US$1 billion into the ride-hailing platform. It had previously made an undisclosed strategic investment in Grab.

seo.title: Grab and Toyota aim to make ride-hailing more efficient
seo.description: Grab will deploy Toyota’s “Total-care Service” to its Singapore fleet, leveraging data to provide drivers with cost-efficient maintenance and insurance.
